name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"95beda8f-7bcc-43b8-8c64-75c2826a3288","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: get_point","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e8de66b6-39c2-495d-bed1-46654fbc3732","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_point","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the primary mechanism for resolving complex, multi-part namespaces into their final, concrete value targets. Its goal is to take a raw string reference—which might be a nested attribute access like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.class.instance.attribute","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"—and determine exactly which definitions it points to. It performs this by recursively decomposing the string, resolving the base parts, and then re-applying the remaining attributes to the resolved targets until a final list of reachable definitions is produced.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5d3c2a6e-fe47-4d43-9f8f-d36fe1edb82b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In Python, variables rarely point to a single static definition; they are often chains of references. For example, to resolve ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"user.profile.name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer first needs to know what ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"user","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is, then look up ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"profile","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on that object, and finally look up ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on the profile. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_point","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" provides the engine for this "inter-procedural" and "structural" resolution. It ensures that the analyzer can follow data through multiple layers of objects and scopes, which is essential for accurate type-checking and dependency mapping.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4b623e2b-cb08-4b2e-89ca-93b7e7b9139d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6e744ab9-9116-4922-be16-e6a6922836d4","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Decomposition (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"helper","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It begins by using the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"helper","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sub-function to split the input namespace. It identifies a "stable" root definition and treats the rest of the dotted path as a sequence of attributes (the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"rightList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") that still need to be resolved.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9f3846fe-f871-4cc6-8b4a-84950b64e398","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Iterative Merging:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It enters a loop that processes the attribute path piece by piece.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"e6d6d9ce-9b20-4e1a-8d83-b81c35da9369","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It takes the current resolved "left" side and tries to find the next "right" attribute on it using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"mergeLeftRight","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"48b5dfbd-ff9e-466b-9985-5090e1a054ae","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" resolves to a specific object, and we are looking for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":".attr","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it finds the definition of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"attr","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" within that object's scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"aa32dfe7-2083-4fd5-8926-09345d6c8018","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Recursive Conversion:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" After each merge, it calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"convert","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to flatten any redirection. If a name points to another name, it follows that chain to find the ultimate value.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d0ccbec9-27aa-4ced-9fcf-7e606d5f8a9d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Normalization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Once the entire path is processed, it runs a final conversion pass (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"convert_final","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to clean up the results, remove internal placeholders (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NA_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and return a deduplicated list of the actual namespaces the original string refers to.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8eb418ee-bc04-4e4b-8ea2-f9218e1a0d1a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Input: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"services.auth_manager.current_user.id","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"23b5c7c2-c601-4b14-b3e4-daa9a7f1af30","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"helper","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" identifies ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"services.auth_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as a known Module/Class. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"rightList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" becomes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"[".current_user", ".id"]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"920cd27f-f9a8-4878-960f-c63824bd0893","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"First Pass:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It merges ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"services.auth_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"current_user","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It resolves this to a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class instance.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9bb2ddaf-415e-4ad3-8d5d-1eef01f073b5","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Second Pass:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It merges the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instance with ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"id","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It finds the definition of the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"id","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" field inside the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"653dedb6-27d8-4920-ba1f-f5800b91ba77","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Result:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"["models.User.id"]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6e401e93-a218-40b2-81f0-e99f86e6d723","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"2a62f66b-0b60-4e2f-9a1b-8de598468b26","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sub-functions","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4dc7e800-108c-4785-af70-0e8fab5544d0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: helper","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6ce33fd5-ee18-4f76-8e59-a5e8a10ab4b1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Splits a namespace into a base definition and a sequence of unresolved suffixes. It walks upward by stripping dots until it hits a meaningful, recognized definition in the system, returning that root and the remaining attribute path for step-by-step resolution.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"05bd0975-2897-437e-8972-00bc9d04864b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
